Title: Simile
References: ŠTULAJTEROVÁ, A., JESENSKÁ, P.: English Stylistics. 1. vyd. Banská Bystrica : Univerzita Mateja Bela, 2013. 114 s.
Content:
A simile is a figure of speech that makes a comparison.

It shows similarities between two different things. The similarity is introduced by the word like or as. Simile helps specify more closely some property, quality, or aspect of some phenomenon, object, person or image in a more expressive way.

examples: 

  • "I wandered lonely as a cloud that floats on high o'er vales and hills."  Daffodils
  • " She's as fierce as a tiger."
